head.title: Dec. 26 - Jan. 1; Giuliani Sees Welfare Victory

hedline.hl1: Dec. 26 - Jan. 1; Giuliani Sees Welfare Victory

block.p: New York City's mayor, Rudolph W. Giuliani, declared victory in his war on welfare. The mayor, a likely Senate candidate, said he had met the deadline he set 18 months ago to end welfare by ''engaging'' all available adult recipients in work or work-preparation in exchange for aid.
But critics loudly disputed his figures, noting for example that recipients counted as successes included thousands merely referred for evaluation for work.
